Entanglement: Just Gaming, 4hour 30 min philosophic-artistic enquiry into artificial intelligence, warfare, fantasy, magic, curated by G Rae and A Nazo (London, 2020); The Photograph of Thought, in D Rubinstein, Fragmentation of the
title: | London, UK Johnny Golding is Professor of Philosophy and Fine Art, School of Arts and Humanities at the Royal College of Art. Golding’s research situates post-Newtonian analytics, contemporary poetics and the logics of sense as ‘radical matter’, an inhabited, art-led onto-epistemological encounter with the wild sciences (artificial and distributed intelligence, non-locality, imaginary numbers, undecidability). Recent essays and poetic installations include

Anatomy Lesson (an Open Letter, in friendship, to Sigmund Freud), presented at the Feud Museum and at Nothing Less! 100 Years of Women’s Suffrage, the Austrian Cultural Forum (2019); Entanglement: The Opera–Artificial Intelligence, Hive Time, [homage to Kurt Weil’s antifascist opera White Cheese
Texts and poetic-philosophic installations most recently exhibited as invited artist: the Venice Biennale
